Isadora Cota Carvalho

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1550950501182699
  • Última atualização do currículo em 16/09/2019

Doctorate candidate at the Center of Nanoscience, Nanotechnology and Innovation, CeNano2I, located at the Department of Metallurgical and Materials Engineering -UFMG. My work has mostly focused on the design and characterization of novel advanced hybrid materials based on modified-polysaccharide networks conjugated with functional nanoparticles for prospective nanotheranostic and environmental applications. My former academic activities comprise my master's studies (2016-2017) when started working with hydrogels, macromolecular engineering, and polymer functionalization. The focus was given in hybrid-polymeric scaffolds composed of polysaccharides and polypeptides for biomedical applications. Also, I was then introduced to deeper material-characterization by physicochemical, spectroscopic and morphological techniques, such as UV-Vis, FTIR, PL, and XPS. As a bachelor in Materials Engineering (Centro Federal de Educação Tecnológica de Minas Gerais, CEFET-MG, Brazil), already during the initial years in the university my interest in researching became stronger, which led me to an international internship at ESPCI ParisTech. Also, to complement my background in materials science and engineering, I had the opportunity to study at Ecole Polytechnique de Bruxelles - ULB as an international student for one year (2014-2015). Still, as an undergraduate student, I received the highest grade honor in the graduate class. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2012 - 2014
Computational Simulations of Granular Systems
Descrição: Develop a software from an application (Castem®) that can make possible the prediction and interpretation of the grain?s response in a given geometry and under a given mechanical overload..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Isadora Cota Carvalho - Integrante / Allbens Atman Picardi Faria - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de Minas Gerais - Bolsa.
